page.title: 10FARMS OF GREENHALGH/ROSEACRE
page.content: Dairy farming is the principal industry in this block. The dairy cattle are predominently Friesian plus Ayrshires and Holsteins. A small amount of hay is made but most grass is cropped as silage. A fairly large amount of nitrogen is used to ensure two or three crops. There are modern milking parlours, dairies and slurry handling methods. Farmers are made very aware of pollution from silage and animal effluent. There are severe penalties. The use of machinery means farms are not so labour intensive. Old buildings have been demolished and replaced by spacious ones of steel framimg with cladding so that tractors are handled indoors, silage clamps made and cattle loose housed. Some sheep and beef cattle are reared and fattened but very ferw pigs. The grassland overall is well managed.
